name: mouseWentUp()
content:
Checks if the mouse button specified was released.

Some interactive games use the mouse for the user to control the game. `mouseWentUp()` generates a single true value when the mouse button is released, no matter how long the button is pressed. Use `mouseDown()` to continually check if the button is pressed.

examples.name: Move to the Mouse
examples.description: Have the sprite move in the direction of the mouse when button was released.

palette_params.name: button
palette_params.description: The mouse button you want to check, either "leftButton" or "rightButton".

short_description: Checks if the mouse button specified was released.
tips: - When testing your games that use keyboard or mouse input make sure you click in the display area before you run, otherwise the Workspace will record your keyboard and mouse actions.
